00004 bool TextureLoader::load(Texture * Tex, DataInputStream* inputStream)
00005 {
00006     tga_header head;
00007 
00008     if (inputStream == 0 || (inputStream->isOpen() == false))
00009     {
00010         printf("Bad input stream\n");
00011         return false;
00012     }
00013 
00014     if(inputStream->read(&head, sizeof(head)) != true)
00015     {
00016         printf("Header read fail\n");
00017         return false;                           // Return False If It Fails
00018     }
00019 
00020     printf("Header size: %i\n", (int) sizeof(head));
00021 
00022     printf("TGA IMAGE DATA\nWidth: %i\nHeight: %i\nImage Type: %i\n", head.width, head.height, head.imageType);
00023 
00024     printf("StartX: %i StartY: %i\n", head.xStart, head.yStart);
00025 
00026     if (head.imageType == 2)
00027     {
00028 
00029         printf("Uncompressed TGA\n");
00030 
00031         if ( !loadUncompressedTGA(Tex, inputStream, &head) )
00032         {
00033 
00034             return false;
00035 
00036         }
00037 
00038     }
00039     else if (head.imageType == 10)
00040     {
00041 
00042         printf("Compressed TGA\n");
00043 
00044         if ( !loadCompressedTGA(Tex, inputStream, &head) )
00045         {
00046 
00047             return false;
00048 
00049         }
00050 
00051     }
00052     else
00053     {
00054 
00055         printf("Unloadable TGA\n");
00056 
00057         printf("Error, This TGA loader is only capable of loading RLE and uncompressed RGB or RGBA based TGA images.\n");
00058 
00059         return false;
00060     }
00061 
00062     printf("Loaded\n");
00063 
00064     return true;
00065 }

00067 //This function swaps the Y rows so that the origin of the image is in the top left format
00068 void swapYRows(uint8_t* Data, tga_header* head)
00069 {
00070     uint8_t bytesPerPixel = head->bits / 8;
00071 
00072     printf("Bytes per pixel: %i", bytesPerPixel);
00073 
00074     unsigned int lineSize = bytesPerPixel * head->width;
00075     unsigned int halfHeight = head->height / 2;
00076     unsigned int maxLine = head->height - 1;
00077 
00078     //Line buffer used when swapping
00079     uint8_t* tempLine = new uint8_t[lineSize];
00080 
00081     //For each line of the image (Only go to half because your swapping top for bottom)
00082     for (unsigned int currentLine = 0; currentLine < halfHeight;  ++currentLine)
00083     {
00084         //Copy the line into the line buffer
00085         memcpy(tempLine, Data + (currentLine * lineSize), lineSize);
00086 
00087         //Replace the lines data with the data from the respective line in the other half
00088         memcpy(Data + (currentLine * lineSize), Data + (maxLine * lineSize) - (currentLine * lineSize), lineSize);
00089 
00090         //Copy the stored data to the respective line in the other half
00091         memcpy(Data + (maxLine * lineSize) - (currentLine * lineSize), tempLine, lineSize);
00092     }
00093 
00094     delete[] tempLine;
00095 }

00097 bool TextureLoader::loadCompressedTGA(Texture* Tex, DataInputStream* stream, tga_header* header)
00098 {
00099 
00100     if((header->bits != 24) && (header->bits !=32))
00101     {
00102         printf("Invalid/Corrupt Header\n");
00103         return false;
00104     }
00105 
00106     if(header->bits == 24)                              // Is It A 24bpp Image?
00107     {
00108         printf("24 BPP\n");
00109     }
00110     else                                                // If It's Not 24, It Must Be 32
00111     {
00112         printf("32 BPP\n");
00113     }
00114 
00115     unsigned int bytesPP = header->bits / 8;
00116 
00117     printf("Bytes per pixel %i\n", bytesPP);
00118 
00119     unsigned int iSize = bytesPP * header->width * header->height;
00120 
00121     uint8_t* iDat = new uint8_t[iSize];
00122 
00123     if(iDat == 0)                       // If Memory Can Not Be Allocated...
00124     {
00125         printf("Unable to allocate space for image\n");
00126         return false;                           // Return False
00127     }
00128 
00129     unsigned int pixelcount = header->height * header->width;   // Number Of Pixels In The Image
00130     unsigned int currentpixel   = 0;                    // Current Pixel We Are Reading From Data
00131     unsigned int currentbyte    = 0;                    // Current Byte We Are Writing Into Imagedata
00132 
00133     // Storage For 1 Pixel
00134     uint8_t* colorbuffer = new uint8_t[bytesPP];
00135 
00136     if (colorbuffer == 0)
00137     {
00138         printf("Color buffer unable to allocate\n");
00139         delete[] iDat;
00140         return false;
00141     }
00142 
00143     do
00144     {
00145         uint8_t chunkheader = 0;                                                                                        /* Storage for "chunk" header */
00146 
00147         if(stream->read(&chunkheader, sizeof(uint8_t)) == false)                                /* Read in the 1 byte header */
00148         {
00149             printf("Error could not read RLE header");                                          /*Display Error */
00150 
00151             if(iDat != NULL)                                                                    /* If there is stored image data */
00152             {
00153                 delete[] iDat;                                                          /* Delete image data */
00154             }
00155 
00156             if (colorbuffer != NULL)
00157                 delete[] colorbuffer;
00158 
00159             return false;                                                                                                       /* Return failed */
00160         }
00161 
00162         if(chunkheader < 128)                                                                                           /* If the ehader is < 128, it means the that is the number of RAW color packets minus 1 */
00163         {
00164 
00165             short counter;                                                                                                      /* that follow the header */
00166             chunkheader++;                                                                                                      /* add 1 to get number of following color values */
00167 
00168             for(counter = 0; counter < chunkheader; counter++)                          /* Read RAW color values */
00169             {
00170 
00171                 if(stream->read(colorbuffer, bytesPP) != true) /* Try to read 1 pixel */
00172                 {
00173 
00174                     printf("Error could not read image data");                          /* IF we cant, display an error */
00175 
00176                     if(colorbuffer != NULL)                                                                     /* See if colorbuffer has data in it */
00177                     {
00178                         printf("Deleting color buffer\n");
00179                         delete[] colorbuffer;                                                           /* If so, delete it */
00180                     }
00181 
00182                     if(iDat != NULL)                                                                            /* See if there is stored Image data */
00183                     {
00184                         printf("Deleting image data\n");
00185                         delete[] iDat;                                                          /* If so, delete it too */
00186                     }
00187 
00188                     return false;                                                                                                               /* Return failed */
00189                 }
00190 
00191                 /* write to memory */
00192                 iDat[currentbyte] = colorbuffer[2];                                 /* Flip R and B vcolor values around in the process */
00193                 iDat[currentbyte + 1] = colorbuffer[1];
00194                 iDat[currentbyte + 2] = colorbuffer[0];
00195 
00196                 if(bytesPP == 4)                                                                                                /* if its a 32 bpp image */
00197                 {
00198                     iDat[currentbyte + 3] = colorbuffer[3];                             /* copy the 4th byte */
00199                 }
00200 
00201                 currentbyte += bytesPP;                                                                         /* Increase thecurrent byte by the number of bytes per pixel */
00202                 currentpixel++;                                                                                                                 /* Increase current pixel by 1 */
00203 
00204                 if(currentpixel > pixelcount)                                                                                   /* Make sure we havent read too many pixels */
00205                 {
00206                     printf("Error too many pixels read");                                                               /* if there is too many... Display an error! */
00207 
00208                     if(colorbuffer != NULL)                                                                                             /* If there is data in colorbuffer */
00209                     {
00210                         delete[] colorbuffer;                                                                                           /* Delete it */
00211                     }
00212 
00213                     if(iDat != NULL)                                                                            /* If there is Image data */
00214                     {
00215                         delete[] iDat;                                                  /* delete it */
00216                     }
00217 
00218                     return false;                                                                                                               /* Return failed */
00219                 }
00220             }
00221         }
00222         else                                                                                                                                                    /* chunkheader > 128 RLE data, next color  reapeated chunkheader - 127 times */
00223         {
00224 
00225             short counter;
00226 
00227             chunkheader -= 127;                                                                                                                 /* Subteact 127 to get rid of the ID bit */
00228 
00229             if(stream->read(colorbuffer, bytesPP) != true)              /* Attempt to read following color values */
00230             {
00231                 printf("Error could not read from file");                       /* If attempt fails.. Display error (again) */
00232 
00233                 if(colorbuffer != NULL)                                                                                                 /* If there is data in the colorbuffer */
00234                 {
00235                     delete[] colorbuffer;                                                                                                       /* delete it */
00236                 }
00237 
00238                 if(iDat != NULL)                                                                                        /* If thereis image data */
00239                 {
00240                     delete[] iDat;                                                                              /* delete it */
00241                 }
00242 
00243                 return false;                                                                                                                   /* return failed */
00244             }
00245 
00246             for(counter = 0; counter < chunkheader; counter++)                                  /* copy the color into the image data as many times as dictated */
00247             {
00248                 /* by the header */
00249                 iDat[currentbyte                ] = colorbuffer[2];                                     /* switch R and B bytes areound while copying */
00250                 iDat[currentbyte + 1    ] = colorbuffer[1];
00251                 iDat[currentbyte + 2    ] = colorbuffer[0];
00252 
00253                 if(bytesPP == 4)                                                                                                /* If TGA images is 32 bpp */
00254                 {
00255                     iDat[currentbyte + 3] = colorbuffer[3];                             /* Copy 4th byte */
00256                 }
00257 
00258                 currentbyte += bytesPP;                                                                         /* Increase current byte by the number of bytes per pixel */
00259                 currentpixel++;                                                                                                                 /* Increase pixel count by 1 */
00260 
00261                 if(currentpixel > pixelcount)                                                                                   /* Make sure we havent written too many pixels */
00262                 {
00263                     printf("Error too many pixels read");                                                               /* if there is too many... Display an error! */
00264 
00265                     if(colorbuffer != NULL)                                                                                             /* If there is data in colorbuffer */
00266                     {
00267                         printf("Deleting color buffer\n");
00268                         delete[] colorbuffer;                                                                                           /* Delete it */
00269                     }
00270 
00271                     if(iDat != NULL)                                                                            /* If there is Image data */
00272                     {
00273                         printf("Deleting image data\n");
00274                         delete[] iDat;                                                                          /* delete it */
00275                     }
00276 
00277                     return false;                                                                                                               /* Return failed */
00278                 }
00279             }
00280         }
00281     }
00282     while(currentpixel < pixelcount);
00283 
00284     delete[] colorbuffer;
00285 
00286     if (header->yStart == 0)
00287     {
00288         swapYRows(iDat, header);
00289     }
00290 
00291     if (header->bits == 24)
00292     {
00293         Tex->loadTextureData(input_data_byte_rgb, header->width, header->height, true, iDat);
00294     }
00295     else if (header->bits == 32)
00296     {
00297         Tex->loadTextureData(input_data_byte_rgba, header->width, header->height, true, iDat);
00298     }
00299 
00300     delete[] iDat;
00301 
00302     return true;
00303 }
00304 
00305 bool TextureLoader::loadUncompressedTGA(Texture* Tex, DataInputStream* stream, tga_header* header)
00306 {
00307 
00308     if((header->bits != 24) && (header->bits !=32))
00309     {
00310         printf("Invalid/Corrupt Header\n");
00311         return false;
00312     }
00313 
00314     if(header->bits == 24)                              // Is It A 24bpp Image?
00315     {
00316         printf("RGB\n");
00317     }
00318     else                                // If It's Not 24, It Must Be 32
00319     {
00320         printf("RGBA\n");
00321     }
00322 
00323     //Bytes per pixel
00324     unsigned int bytesPP = header->bits / 8;
00325 
00326     //Image data
00327     uint8_t* iDat = new uint8_t[bytesPP * header->width * header->height];
00328 
00329     if (iDat == 0)
00330     {
00331         printf("Unable to allocate image data for uncompressed TGA image\n");
00332         return false;
00333     }
00334 
00335     if(stream->read(iDat, bytesPP * header->width * header->height) != true)
00336     {
00337         printf("Error: FREAD returned fail trying to read uncompressed TGA file\n");
00338         delete[] iDat;
00339         return false;                           // If We Cant, Return False
00340     }
00341 
00342     //uint8_t redByte = 0;
00343     //uint8_t blueByte = 0;
00344 
00345     for(unsigned int cswap = 0; cswap <  bytesPP * header->width * header->height; cswap += bytesPP)
00346     {
00347 
00348         /*
00349         The OLD slower way of doing it with intermediates
00350         blueByte = iDat[cswap];
00351         redByte = iDat[cswap + 2];
00352 
00353         iDat[cswap] = redByte;
00354         iDat[cswap + 2] = blueByte;
00355         */
00356 
00357         //The new way is to use a XOR trick to swap the two values
00358 
00359         //Set the value of the R position to the XORed value of the B
00360         iDat[cswap] ^= iDat[cswap + 2];
00361 
00362         //Set the value of the B to the XORed value of the R (This leaves the correct B value)
00363         iDat[cswap + 2] ^= iDat[cswap];
00364 
00365         //Set the value of the R to the XOred value of the new B (Leaving the resultant as the correct R value)
00366         iDat[cswap] ^= iDat[cswap + 2];
00367 
00368     }
00369 
00370     if (header->yStart != 0)
00371     {
00372         swapYRows(iDat, header);
00373     }
00374 
00375     if (header->bits == 24)
00376     {
00377         Tex->loadTextureData(input_data_byte_rgb, header->width, header->height, true, iDat);
00378     }
00379     else if (header->bits == 32)
00380     {
00381         Tex->loadTextureData(input_data_byte_rgba, header->width, header->height, true, iDat);
00382     }
00383 
00384     free(iDat);
00385 
00386     return true;
00387 }
